text: scientists who have a great interest in
stickiness have found some experts these
torrent frogs scientists wanted to know
what their secret is because stickiness
is important to people to think duct
tape velcro superglue so they caught a
few torrent frogs and some tree frogs
for comparison in the rainforests of
Borneo then in a mobile lab they treated
their captives to a kind of benign
waterboarding using a tiltable board
with three different surfaces look as
the Frog clings on to the board until
it's almost upside down no surprise the
torrent frogs were better than the tree
frogs they're a bit lighter than free
frogs which helps and they flatten and
paste themselves to the board while the
tree frogs put too much confidence in
their toes scientists haven't answered
all their questions yet but they think
they will as long as they stick with
